law.catch_line: Renewal of license and annual report -- Expiration and reinstatement of license.

text.section: A licensee under this subtitle shall pay an annual renewal fee of five hundred dollars ($500) no later than September 20 of each year.

The failure of a licensee to pay the annual renewal fee or file the written renewal report, by the renewal date of September 20, shall result in the expiration of the licensee's license by operation of law by September 30 of the same year. The commissioner may reinstate the license if the licensee becomes compliant with this subtitle and pays a civil penalty equal to the amount of the annual renewal fee, as specified in this section, within thirty (30) days of the expiration of the license.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 839, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 247, sec. 11, effective April 24, 2006.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/12/2006). This section was created in 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 247 as a new section of KRS Chapter 366A. Sec. 38 of that same bill also required that all sections of KRS Chapters 287, 288, 290, 291, 294, 366, 366A, and 368 be renumbered as sections of a single KRS chapter entitled the "Kentucky Financial Services Code." Therefore, the Statute Reviser, acting under KRS 7.136(1), has codified this section as a new section of KRS Chapter 286.
